qas.question: What event made war planning difficult in this period?
What position was held by General MacArthur at this point in time?
What encampment was attacked in 1932 by soldiers including Eisenhower?
What sort of people did the Bonus March consist of?

context: His primary duty was planning for the next war, which proved most difficult in the midst of the <a0_0>Great Depression<a0_0/>. He then was posted as chief military aide to General MacArthur, <a1_0>Army Chief of Staff<a1_0/>. In 1932, he participated in the clearing of the <a2_0>Bonus March<a2_0/> encampment in Washington, D.C. Although he was against the actions taken against the <a3_0>veterans<a3_0/> and strongly advised MacArthur against taking a public role in it, he later wrote the Army's official incident report, endorsing MacArthur's conduct.
